Title:
Examination of the generic concept and species boundaries of
the genus Erioscyphella (Lachnaceae, Helotiales, Ascomycota) with the
proposal of new species and new combinations based on the Japanese
materials
Keywords:
ITS, morphology, phylogeny, species delimitation, species
hypothesis, taxonomy, UNITE
Abstract:
The genus Erioscyphella Kirschst., which was
morphologically confused with Lachnum, was herein examined. Based on
molecular phylogenetic analyses using a combined dataset of ITS, LSU,
mtSSU, and RPB2 and morphological examinations, Erioscyphella was
distinguished from Lachnum and redefined by longer ascospores and the
presence of apical amorphous materials and/or resinous materials
equipped on hairs. Species boundaries recognized by morphology/ecology
and phylogenetic analyses were cross-checked using species delimitation
analyses based on DNA barcode sequences downloaded from UNITE, resulting
in that speciesÂ’ taxonomic problems being uncovered. Six new species (E.
boninensis, E. insulae, E. otanii, E. papillaris, E. paralushanensis,
and E. sasibrevispora) and two new combinations (E. hainanensis and E.
sinensis) were proposed.
